Package ohos.bundle

Interface IBundleManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IRemoteBroker

    public interface IBundleManager
extends IRemoteBroker
    Obtains information related to the application bundle.
    Since:
    1

        Indicates that bundle information to return includes requested permission information.

        The value is 0x00000010.

        getBundleInfo(String, int), Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_DENIED

        static final int PERMISSION_DENIED
        Indicates that the application does not have a particular permission.

        During permission check, this value is returned if the application does not have the specific permission or the check fails due to other reasons.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        PERMISSION_GRANTED, checkPermission(String, String), Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_GRANTED

        static final int PERMISSION_GRANTED
        Indicates that the application has been granted a particular permission.

        During permission check, this value is returned if the application already has the specific permission. Otherwise, PERMISSION_DENIED is returned.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        PERMISSION_DENIED, checkPermission(String, String), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getBundleInfo

        BundleInfo getBundleInfo​(String bundleName,
                         int flags)
                  throws RemoteException
        Obtains the BundleInfo based on a given bundle name.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED or ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level, and the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission is of the normal level.

        Information contained in the BundleInfo object to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns the basic BundleInfo object.
        • 0x00000001: Returns the BundleInfo object with abilityInfo specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the application bundle name to be queried.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the BundleInfo that will be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleInfo object.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • getBundleInfo

        BundleInfo getBundleInfo​(String networkId,
                         String bundleName,
                         int flags)
                  throws RemoteException
        Obtains the BundleInfo based on a given networkId and bundle name.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED or ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level, and the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission is of the normal level.

        Information contained in the BundleInfo object to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns the basic BundleInfo object.
        • 0x00000001: Returns the BundleInfo object with abilityInfo specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        networkId - Indicates the device networkId in area network.
        bundleName - Indicates the application bundle name to be queried.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the BundleInfo that will be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleInfo object.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        5

      • getBundleInstaller

        IBundleInstaller getBundleInstaller​()
                             throws RemoteException
        Obtains the interface used to install bundles.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.INSTALL_BUNDLE permission from the system.

        Returns:
        Returns the IBundleInstaller interface.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • getApplicationInfo

        ApplicationInfo getApplicationInfo​(String bundleName,
                                   int flags,
                                   int userId)
                            throws RemoteException
        Obtains the ApplicationInfo based on a given bundle name.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED or ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level, and the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission is of the normal level.

        Information contained in the ApplicationInfo object to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns the basic ApplicationInfo object.
        • 0x00000008: Returns the ApplicationInfo object with permission specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the application bundle name to be queried.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the ApplicationInfo object that will be returned.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the ApplicationInfo object.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • checkPermission

        int checkPermission​(String bundleName,
                    String permission)
        Checks whether a specified bundle has been granted a specific permission.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the name of the bundle to check.
        permission - Indicates the permission to check.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the bundle has the permission; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • queryAbilityByIntent

        List<AbilityInfo> queryAbilityByIntent​(Intent intent,
                                       int flags,
                                       int userId)
                                throws RemoteException
        Queries all AbilityInfo information based on the given intent.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED or ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level, and the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission is of the normal level.

        Information contained in the AbilityInfo objects to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns basic AbilityInfo objects.
        • 0x00000002: Returns AbilityInfo objects with permission specified.
        • 0x00000004: Returns AbilityInfo objects with applicationInfo specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent containing the application bundle name to be queried.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the AbilityInfo objects that will be returned.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of AbilityInfo objects.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • getBundleInfos

        List<BundleInfo> getBundleInfos​(int flags)
                         throws RemoteException
        Obtains BundleInfo of all bundles available in the system.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Information contained in the BundleInfo objects to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns basic BundleInfo objects.
        • 0x00000001: Returns BundleInfo objects with abilityInfo specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the BundleInfo that will be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of BundleInfo objects.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • getUidByBundleName

        int getUidByBundleName​(String bundleName,
                       int userId)
                throws RemoteException
        Obtains the application UID based on the given bundle name and user ID.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED or ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level, and the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission is of the normal level.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the UID of the application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • getBundlesForUid

        List<String> getBundlesForUid​(int uid)
                       throws RemoteException
        Obtains all bundle names of a specified application based on the given application UID.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        uid - Indicates the application UID.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of bundle names.
        Throws:

        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        1

      • registerAllPermissionsChanged

        void registerAllPermissionsChanged​(IRemoteObject callback)
                            throws RemoteException
        Registers a callback for listening for permission changes of all UIDs.

        After this method is called, the caller will be notified when the permission of any UID changes. You can call unregisterPermissionsChanged(ohos.rpc.IRemoteObject) to unregister the listener.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback method to register.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        2
        See Also:
        registerPermissionsChanged(int[], IRemoteObject), unregisterPermissionsChanged(IRemoteObject)

      • registerPermissionsChanged

        void registerPermissionsChanged​(int[] uids,
                                IRemoteObject callback)
                         throws RemoteException
        Registers a callback for listening for permission changes of specified UIDs.

        After this method is called, the caller will be notified when the permission of a given UID changes. You can call unregisterPermissionsChanged(ohos.rpc.IRemoteObject) to unregister the listener.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        uids - Indicates the list of UIDs whose permission changes will be monitored.
        callback - Indicates the callback method to register.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        2
        See Also:
        registerAllPermissionsChanged(IRemoteObject), unregisterPermissionsChanged(IRemoteObject)

      • unregisterPermissionsChanged

        void unregisterPermissionsChanged​(IRemoteObject callback)
                           throws RemoteException
        Unregisters a specified callback for listening for permission changes.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.LISTEN_PERMISSION_CHANGE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback method to unregister.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        2
        See Also:
        registerAllPermissionsChanged(IRemoteObject), registerPermissionsChanged(int[], IRemoteObject)

      • getApplicationInfos

        List<ApplicationInfo> getApplicationInfos​(int flags,
                                          int userId)
                                   throws RemoteException
        Obtains information about all installed applications of a specified user.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Information contained in the ApplicationInfo object to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns the basic ApplicationInfo object.
        • 0x00000008: Returns the ApplicationInfo object with permission specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the ApplicationInfo objects that will be returned.
        userId - Indicates the user ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of ApplicationInfo objects.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • checkPublicKeys

        int checkPublicKeys​(String firstBundleName,
                    String secondBundleName)
             throws RemoteException
        Checks whether the publickeys of two bundles are the same.
        Parameters:
        firstBundleName - Indicates the name of a bundle to compare.
        secondBundleName - Indicates the name of another bundle to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns SIGNATURE_UNKNOWN_BUNDLE if at least one of the given bundles is not found; returns SIGNATURE_NOT_MATCHED if their publickeys are different; returns SIGNATURE_MATCHED if their publickeys are the same.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        Since:
        3

      • getNameForUid

        String getNameForUid​(int uid)
              throws RemoteException
        Obtains the formal name associated with the given UID. The formal name will never change but the UID may. Therefore, if you want to store information about UIDs, you should store their formal names instead of the raw UIDs.
        Parameters:
        uid - Indicates the UID of an application.
        Returns:
        Returns the unique name associated with the UID in <i>shared-userid</i>:<i>uid</i> format if shared-userid has been configured in the config.json file; returns the bundle name otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        Since:
        3

      • getBundleArchiveInfo

        BundleInfo getBundleArchiveInfo​(String hapFilePath,
                                int flags)
        Obtains information about an application bundle contained in a HarmonyOS Ability Package (HAP).

        Information contained in the BundleInfo object to be returned varies depending on the value of the flags parameter.

        • 0x00000000: Returns the basic BundleInfo object.
        • 0x00000001: Returns the BundleInfo object with abilityInfo specified.
        • Other value: Returns the same result as 0x00000000.
        Parameters:
        hapFilePath - Indicates the path storing the HAP. The path should be the relative path to the data directory of the current application.
        flags - Indicates the flag used to specify information contained in the BundleInfo object to be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the BundleInfo object.
        Since:
        3

      • isSafeMode

        boolean isSafeMode​()
        Checks whether the current device has been started in safe mode.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the device is in safe mode; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getLaunchIntentForBundle

        Intent getLaunchIntentForBundle​(String bundleName)
                         throws RemoteException
        Obtains the Intent for starting the main ability of an application based on the given bundle name. The main ability of an application is the ability that has the Intent.ACTION_HOME and Intent.ENTITY_HOME intent filters set in the application's config.json file.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission from the system. The ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        Returns:
        Returns the Intent for starting the application's main ability if any; returns null if the given bundle does not exist or does not contain any main ability.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • setApplicationEnabled

        void setApplicationEnabled​(String bundleName,
                           boolean isEnabled)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets whether to enable a specified application.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.CHANGE_ABILITY_ENABLED_STATE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.CHANGE_ABILITY_ENABLED_STATE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        isEnabled - Specifies whether to enable the application. The value true means to enable it, and the value false means to disable it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the given bundle does not exist.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception to indicate a security violation.
        Since:
        3

      • setAbilityEnabled

        void setAbilityEnabled​(AbilityInfo abilityInfo,
                       boolean isEnabled)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets whether to enable a specified ability.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.CHANGE_ABILITY_ENABLED_STATE permission from the system. The ohos.permission.CHANGE_ABILITY_ENABLED_STATE permission is of the signature|privileged level.

        Parameters:
        abilityInfo - Indicates information about the ability to set.
        isEnabled - Specifies whether to enable the ability. The value true means to enable it, and the value false means to disable it.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the given ability does not exist.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception to indicate a security violation.
        Since:
        3

      • startBackupSession

        int startBackupSession​(IBackupSessionCallback callback)
        Starts a backup or restoration session. This method should be called before a backup or restoration task is executed.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the IBackupSessionCallback used to notify the application of the backup or restoration task status.
        Returns:
        Returns a positive integer to be used as the session ID for further task processing if the session is successfully started; returns -1 if a common failure occurs;returns -2 if your application does not have permission to call this method.
        Since:
        3

      • executeBackupTask

        int executeBackupTask​(int sessionId,
                      String taskCmd)
        Executes a backup or restoration task.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Indicates the session ID for the backup or restoration task.
        taskCmd - Indicates the task command to execute.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the task is successfully started; returns -1 if a common failure occurs; returns -2 if your application does not have permission to call this method; returns -3 if the task command is not supported;returns -4 if the task command has been issued.
        Since:
        3

      • finishBackupSession

        int finishBackupSession​(int sessionId)
        Finishes a backup or restoration session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Indicates the ID of the session to finish.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the session is successfully finished; returns -1 if a common failure occurs; returns -2 if your application does not have permission to call this method.
        Since:
        3

      • getShortcutInfos

        List<ShortcutInfo> getShortcutInfos​(String bundleName)
                             throws RemoteException
        Obtains information about the shortcuts of the application.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission from the system. The ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission is of the signature level.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of ShortcutInfo objects containing shortcut information about the application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • cleanBundleCacheFiles

        void cleanBundleCacheFiles​(String bundleName,
                           ICleanCacheCallback callback)
        Clears cache data of a specified application.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.REMOVE_CACHE_FILES permission.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application whose cache data is to be cleared.
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked for returning the operation result. For details, see ICleanCacheCallback.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permission.
        Since:
        3

      • startShortcut

        void startShortcut​(String shortcutId,
                   String bundleName)
            throws RemoteException
        Starts a shortcut based on the given shortcut ID and bundle name.

        To use this method, you need to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission from the system. The ohos.permission.MANAGE_SHORTCUTS permission is of the signature level.

        Parameters:
        shortcutId - Indicates the ID of the shortcut to start.
        bundleName - BundleName Indicates the bundle name of the application to which the shortcut belongs.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • getAppType

        String getAppType​(String bundleName)
           throws RemoteException
        Obtains the type of a specified application based on the given bundle name.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application.
        Returns:
        Returns system if the application is a system application; returns normal if it is released in Huawei AppGallery; returns other if it is released by a third-party vendor; returns an empty string if the query fails.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the system failed to obtain the bundle manager service.

      • isShortcutExist

        int isShortcutExist​(String shortcutId,
                    int flag)
        Checks whether a specified shortcut is available.
        Parameters:
        shortcutId - Indicates the ID of the shortcut to check.
        flag - Indicates the type of the shortcut to check. Currently, only the home-screen shortcut IBundleManager#QUERY_SHORTCUT_HOME is available.
        Returns:
        Returns IBundleManager#SHORTCUT_EXISTENCE_EXISTS if the specified shortcut is available; returns IBundleManager#SHORTCUT_EXISTENCE_NOT_EXISTS if it is not available; returns IBundleManager.SHORTCUT_EXISTENCE_UNKNOW if an error occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • addHomeShortcut

        boolean addHomeShortcut​(ShortcutInfo shortcutInfo)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                        IllegalStateException
        Adds a home-screen shortcut that will be fixed on the home screen.
        Parameters:
        shortcutInfo - Indicates the ShortcutInfo object containing information about the home-screen shortcut to add. The id, label, and intent attributes of this parameter must be specified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the shortcut is successfully added; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the id, label, or intents attribute of the shortcutInfo parameter is null or if the shortcut to be added already exists but is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the calling application is running in the background.
        Since:
        3

      • getAllFormsInfo

        List<FormInfo> getAllFormsInfo​()
                        throws RemoteException
        Obtains the FormInfo objects provided by all HarmonyOS applications on the device.

        Permission: SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED

        Returns:
        Returns a list of FormInfo objects if obtained; returns an empty List if no FormInfo is available on the device.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if FormInfo fails to be obtained due to a connection error between the application and bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if the application is not granted with the SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission.
        Since:
        4

      • getFormsInfoByApp

        List<FormInfo> getFormsInfoByApp​(String bundleName)
                          throws RemoteException
        Obtains the FormInfo objects provided by a specified HarmonyOS application on the device.

        Permission: SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the HarmonyOS application. Specifically, it is the value of the bundleName attribute defined in the app tag of the config.json file for the Harmony application.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of FormInfo objects if obtained; returns an empty List if no FormInfo is provided by the specified application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if FormInfo fails to be obtained due to a connection error between the application and bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if the application is not granted with the SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission.

        4

        FormInfo

      • getFormsInfoByModule

        List<FormInfo> getFormsInfoByModule​(String bundleName,
                                    String moduleName)
                             throws RemoteException
        Obtains the FormInfo objects provided by a specified application module on the device.

        Permission: SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the HarmonyOS application. Specifically, it is the value of the bundleName attribute defined in the app tag of the config.json file for the Harmony application.
        moduleName - Indicates the module name of the HarmonyOS application. Specifically, it is the value of the moduleName sub-attribute of the distro attribute defined in the module tag of the config.json file for the Harmony application.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of FormInfo objects if obtained; returns an empty List if no FormInfo is provided by the specified application module.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if FormInfo fails to be obtained due to a connection error between the application and bundle manager service.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if the application is not granted with the SystemPermission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO_PRIVILEGED permission.
        Since:
        4

        FormInfo

        moduleName - Indicates the module name of the HarmonyOS application. Specifically, it is the value of the moduleName sub-attribute of the distro attribute defined in the module tag of the config.json file for the Harmony application.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of FormInfo objects if obtained; returns an empty List if no FormInfo is provided by the specified application module.
